content: Is there a list / are there lists of who's doing what at HIMSS?
Good heavens ... this is what I get for trying to be a grown-up for a change... :-)
YOu've hit 70. You don't have to be a grown up anymore
DaVinci has two booths - all FHIR-based stuff
The Interoperability Showcase will have many FHIR-based stuff. We'll be there with our app and some other things

The FHIR Business Alliance (SmileCDR, Firely, Aegis, 1upHealth): "FHIRBall will officially launch at HIMSS20. We invite you to booth 8200-69 to discover the benefits of working with the FHIRBall products."
Dave, the interop showcase is a good one to target
As is the Redox party on Monday :innocent:

When you go to the Interop Showcase... MAKE SURE you ask lots of questions about FHIR, and about Patient Empowerment... They should be ready for these questions, I have been working behind the scenes to encourage them.. but I am not on those committees so can't do much but encourage from below.
On the overall question... I think it would be easier to answer "where will FHIR not be spoken?" For which I would assert that you will not find a handful of places where FHIR is not spoken about.

John Moehrke said:

I would assert that you will not find a handful of places where FHIR is not spoken about.

So perhaps I need a separate thread on "things that will be really interesting to people on the patient side of things"?

Nonetheless, there's value to knowing about things like FHIRBall.

And hey @Rien Wertheim is there any reason we shouldn't have SOMEthing SOMEwhere touting the Patient Innovator Track, encouraging interested people to submit their entries??

I don't think either Firely or DevDays has a dedicated exhibit - should there be something at FHIRBall?
The FHIRBall isn't the place. This is for businesses. I can ask Pat if we can do something in the HL7 booth. I'll cc you.
